designations.source: A review of the status of Larger Brachycera flies of Great Britain
designations.source_description: This report was commissioned to update the threat status of Larger Brachycera flies last undertaken in 1991, using a more modern IUCN methodology for assessing threat
designations.reporting_category: Red listing based on 2001 IUCN guidelines
designations.designation_description: Taxa which are neither threatened nor near threatened.
designations.comments: Atrichops crassipes has been recorded from six hectads since 1990 but the tiny proportion of records from early and recent hectads suggests that recording has not yet covered much of the species’ range. The apparently large decline of 70% since 1990 may be due to several records being of larvae recorded in a period of greater aquatic sampling activity in the 1980s; since such records have not been collected more recently, the real distribution is probably closer to that given by all relatively recent hectads (15 hectads since 1980, eight before 1980). Atrichops was considered exceptionally rare earlier in the 20th century, and it may have become more frequent in the last 30 years. Moved beyond NR, invoking Criterion 7 & 2
